page.title: 15METHODIST CHAPEL -WILDHERN
page.content: The Wildhern Methodist Chapel was built in 1880, after the previous building was destroyed by fire. At that time a Mr. Butterworth who owned Hatherden House and farm attended the services.His carpenter,Mr. Hunt, made a seat which is still in use in the chapel. Mr. Henry Smith and his family were also members and his grandson Harry was organist for over 50 years until his death in 1963. His daughter still lives in Wildhern and is also a member.Oil lamps were used until 1948 when the electric light was installed. The numbers in the congregation varies but when the anniversary is celebrated in July each year, a special service is arranged with the visit of a choir and the chapel is usually full.
